title: Mac Mailing
content:
Has anyone any idea why my Maill application sends some emails and not others giving me this error:   
   
--------------------------------------------   
This message could not be delivered and will remain in your Outbox until it can be delivered.   
   
Verify that you have addressed this message correctly. Check your SMTP server settings in Mail Preferences and verify any advanced settings with your system administrator.   
-----------------------------------------------   
   
The address is correct and so are the SMPT settings.   
   
Thanks for any help,   
David.
author: david_leonard

comments.content:
This happens to me when our T1 goes down.   
   
Close out of Mail, ascertain things are up and running, and then restart.

Does your ISP have a POP before SMTP setting (i.e., do you have to check e-mail before you can send)? Some ISP's do this to prevent spamming. Mine does. It made me really mad until I was able to set my mailer programs right.

It is a POP account. Though i have never noticed if i had to check mail first, do you mean I actually have to click on the mail "to check" because i get alot of junk and just delete such mails. This is all just on my laptop so I am not connected to a server, when I connect to the internet I open mail it checks for new mails from an account I have with an email provider and some mails I hit reply, type my message and that error appears.
that can work too, I think. I set something somewhere in mail to always do this automatically. I don't remember what it was, because by the time I found it, I had searched for ever, and was so beat,
